column4: i got another question. i installed kubuntu and now want to switch to ubuntu. ive installed the ubuntu-desktop package but is there a way to completely remove kubuntu and kde stuff?
thank you very much!!
are u guys using other styles than the default for gnome? like other icons/window borders and so on?
yea I am
look for compiz
i think compiz is isntalled by default here
if you use synaptic-package-manager, then install the compiz advanced settings manager. yes it is
ok thanks ill write thtat down
its called Compiz configuration settings manager in synaptic
wait, I meant compizconfig-settings-manager
if you looking for icons/borders have a look at gnome-loog.org
I cant spell today. I meant http://www.gnome-look.org/
ok thanks ;D
right-click properties.
or you could use a dock like cairo-dock or AWN
ill have a look at cairo-dock didnt test it yet
just make sure you download and install cairo-dock2.0 not the 1.? that is in the repositories.
2.0.9 is in repos
oh, my bad.
hehe np ;D now u know ^^
